body:
Comment 17 by **guelfey**: 
> I don't like the idea that the expanding algorithm would be set in stone (in specs).

It already is. Quoting from http://golang.org/ref/spec#Appending_and_copying_slices:

"If the capacity of s is not large enough to fit the additional values, append allocates
a new, sufficiently large slice that fits both the existing slice elements and the
additional values. Thus, the returned slice may refer to a different underlying array."

I basically just want to add these 2 sentences to the Slices article, which should make
the semantics of append clear enough.
